intro: Nemesia gracilis, commonly known as slender nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and violet. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Nemesia gracilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
